cvar.name: IB_EAGER_THRESH
cvar.desc: This is the eager threshold to apply to the IB rails

cvar.name: IB_VERBOSE
cvar.desc: Defines the verbose level of the Infiniband interface .

cvar.name: IB_BUFFERED_THRESH
cvar.desc: Max size for using the Buffered protocol (message split into several Eager messages).

cvar.name: IB_TX_DEPTH
cvar.desc: Number of entries to allocate in the QP for sending messages. If too low, may cause an QP overrun.

cvar.name: IB_RX_DEPTH
cvar.desc: Number of entries to allocate in the QP for receiving messages. Must be 0 if using SRQ

cvar.name: IB_CQ_DEPTH
cvar.desc: Number of entries to allocate in the CQ. If too low, may cause a CQ overrun

cvar.name: IB_RDMA_DEPTH
cvar.desc: Number of RDMA resources on QP (covers both max_dest_rd_atomic and max_rd_atomic)

cvar.name: IB_MAX_SG_SQ
cvar.desc: Max pending RDMA operations for send

cvar.name: IB_MAX_SG_RQ
cvar.desc: Max pending RDMA operations for recv

cvar.name: IB_MAX_INLINE
cvar.desc: Max size for inlining messages

cvar.name: IB_RDMA_RESIZING
cvar.desc: Defines if RDMA connections may be resized.

cvar.name: IB_RDMA_CONN
cvar.desc: Number of RDMA buffers allocated for each neighbor

cvar.name: IB_RDMA_MAX_RESIZING
cvar.desc: Max number of RDMA buffers resizing allowed

cvar.name: IB_INIT_IBUF
cvar.desc: Max number of Eager buffers to allocate during the initialization step

cvar.name: IB_INIT_RECV_IBUF
cvar.desc: Defines the number of receive buffers initially allocated. The number is on-the-fly expanded when needed (see init_recv_ibufs_chunk)

cvar.name: IB_MAX_SRQ_IBUF
cvar.desc: Max number of Eager buffers which can be used by the SRQ. This number is not fixed by the HW

cvar.name: IB_MAX_SRQ_IBUF_POSTED
cvar.desc: Max number of Eager buffers which can be posted to the SRQ. This number cannot be higher than the number fixed by the HW

cvar.name: IB_SRQ_CREDIT_LIMIT
cvar.desc: Min number of free recv Eager buffers before posting a new buffer.

cvar.name: IB_SRQ_CREDIT_LIMIT_THREAD
cvar.desc: Min number of free recv Eager buffers before the activation of the asynchronous thread. If this thread is activated too many times, the performance may be decreased.

cvar.name: IB_IBUF_CHUNK
cvar.desc: Number of new buffers allocated when no more buffers are available.

cvar.name: IB_MMU_INIT
cvar.desc: Number of MMU entries allocated during the MPC initialization.

cvar.name: IB_CAN_STEAL
cvar.desc: Defines if the steal in MPI is allowed

cvar.name: IB_QUIET_CRASH
cvar.desc: Defines if the Infiniband interface must crash quietly.

cvar.name: IB_ASYNC_THREAD
cvar.desc: Defines if the asynchronous may be started at the MPC initialization.

cvar.name: IB_WC_IN
cvar.desc: Defines the number of entries for the CQ dedicated to received messages.

cvar.name: IB_WC_OUT
cvar.desc: Defines the number of entries for the CQ dedicated to sent messages.

cvar.name: IB_RECV_IBUF_CHUNK
cvar.desc: Defines the number of receive buffers allocated on the fly.

cvar.name: IB_MMU_CHACHE_ENABLED
cvar.desc: Defines if the MMU cache is enabled.

cvar.name: IB_MMU_CHACHE_COUNT
cvar.desc: Number of entries to keep in the cache.

cvar.name: IB_MMU_CHACHE_MAX_SIZE
cvar.desc: Total size of entries to keep in the cache.

cvar.name: IB_MMU_CHACHE_MAX_PIN_SIZE
cvar.desc: Maximum size of an pinned entry.

cvar.name: PT_EAGER_LIMIT
cvar.desc: Size of the eager buffers (short messages).

cvar.name: SHM_BUFF_PRIORITY
cvar.desc: Defines priority for the SHM buffered message

cvar.name: SHM_BUFF_MIN_SIZE
cvar.desc: Defines the min size for the SHM buffered message

cvar.name: SHM_BUFF_MAX_SIZE
cvar.desc: Defines the max size for the SHM buffered message

cvar.name: SHM_BUFF_ZEROCOPY
cvar.desc: Defines if mode zerocopy should be actived for SHM buffered message

cvar.name: SHM_CMA_ENABLE
cvar.desc: Are CMA messages enabled

cvar.name: SHM_CMA_PRIORITY
cvar.desc: Defines priority for the SHM CMA message

cvar.name: SHM_CMA_MIN_SIZE
cvar.desc: Defines the min size for the SHM CMA message

cvar.name: SHM_CMA_MAX_SIZE
cvar.desc: Defines the max size for the SHM CMA message

cvar.name: SHM_CMA_ZEROCOPY
cvar.desc: Defines if mode zerocopy should be actived for SHM CMA message

cvar.name: SHM_FRAG_PRIORITY
cvar.desc: Defines priority for the SHM fragmented message

cvar.name: SHM_FRAG_MIN_SIZE
cvar.desc: Defines the min size for the SHM fragmented message

cvar.name: SHM_FRAG_MAX_SIZE
cvar.desc: Defines the max size for the SHM fragmented message

cvar.name: SHM_FRAG_ZEROCOPY
cvar.desc: Defines if mode zerocopy should be actived for SHM fragmented message

cvar.name: SHM_SIZE
cvar.desc: Size of shared memory region.

cvar.name: SHM_CELLS
cvar.desc: Number of cells in the memory region

cvar.name: ITT_BARRIER_ARITY
cvar.desc: Arity of the barrier

cvar.name: ITT_BROADCAST_ARITY
cvar.desc: Arity of the broadcast

cvar.name: ITT_BROADCAST_MAX_SIZE
cvar.desc: Maximum size of the broadcast

cvar.name: ITT_BROADCAST_CHECK_TH
cvar.desc: Enable broadcast threshold check

cvar.name: ITT_ALLREDUCE_ARITY_MAX
cvar.desc: Arity of the allreduce

cvar.name: ITT_ALLREDUCE_MAX_SIZE
cvar.desc: Maximum size of the allreduce

cvar.name: ITT_ALLREDUCE_CHECK_TH
cvar.desc: Enable allreduce threshold check

cvar.name: ITT_ALLREDUCE_MAX_SLOT
cvar.desc: Slot size for allreduce
